newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia's Mahathir says budget to be pro-growth.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia's Mahathir says budget to be pro-growth.

text.p: Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Monday the 1997 budget would include measures to encourage economic growth, protect the environment and promote information technology industries.
"The budget will be aimed at increasing growth and also taking care of the environment," Mahathir told reporters after opening an electric power conference in Kuala Lumpur.
Mahathir also said the budget would aim to "reduce the balance of payments and in particular to stimulate growth in the Multi-Media Super Corridor".
"These are generally the basic strategies of the budget," he added.

The multi-media corridor is a 15-by-15 km zone launched by Mahathir in August. Stretching from Kuala Lumpur to where a new international airport and federal capital are under construction in the south, it aims to attract world-class information technology firms.
The 1997 budget will be presented to the Malaysian parliament by Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister Anwar Ibrahim on Friday. -- Kuala Lumpur newsroom (603-230 8911)
